result.execSummary:
The defendant Dalton L Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: with any other probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  

No contact with Victim A, her family or her residence, directly or through any third party.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff (friend of the court).   
Victim A appeared in court by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Victim A presented a statement to the court.


FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  3 Years.
Court will allow for tranfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to: any other probation.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim A, her family or her residence, directly or through any third party..
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff (friend of the court).   
Victim A appeared in court by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of right to a preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendants waiver of prelim.
Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.
Bail remains as fixed.
Information filed  Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waived reading and enters a Not Guilty Plea.

records.addlTxt:
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody, with attorney Robert N. Meyeroff (as friend of the court).   
Victim A appeared in court by zoom.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendants waiver of prelim.
Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.
Bail remains as fixed.
Information filed  Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waived reading and enters a Not Guilty Plea.
for Protective Order, filed by the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.

Protective order filed and signed by CC Herring
The original document name was titled: Proposed protective Order
The original history event date is: 06-30-2022
Proposed protective order to be signed

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Antonio A./Tarissa H. listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant is to comply with all bail conditions in Waukesha County Cases 22CM125 and 22CF628.

02:00 PM Defendant Dalton L Richardson in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and the Court reads the Criminal Complaint to the defendant on the record.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter for a status of the preliminary hearing on the same date the defendant's other matters are set for.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dalton L Richardson
